title: Bug 49235: Unexpected output in ServletContainerInitializer onStartup method
description: When calling the onStartup method of the ServletContainerInitializer class with a set of classes, the output is 'MySomeAnn' instead of the expected output 'MySomeClass'. This is not consistent with the Servlet 3.0 specification. The code works fine on Glassfish 3.0.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Build Tomcat 7.0.0 from svn r939221. 2. Use the following code: @MySomeAnn public class MySomeClass { ... } @HandlesTypes(MySomeAnn.class) public class ModuleInitializer implements ServletContainerInitializer { @Override public void onStartup(Set<Class<?>> classSet, ServletContext ctx) throws ServletException { for (Class<?> targetClass : classSet) { System.out.println(targetClass.getName()); ... } } } The output should be 'MySomeClass' instead of 'MySomeAnn'.
